sub_title: Senior Full Stack Engineer at Abcam (contractor)
summary:
Experienced software developer with a proven track record at both large Fortune 500 companies and small scale startups. Developed software and delivered results both as a developer part of an integral team and as a solo developer, using agile methodologies. I strive to be an engineer that can deliver complex, tailored and scalable solutions.

I'm an engineer with 'T' shaped skills. My primary field is Front-end application development. I'm also proficient at back end development (with Node.js) and DevOps.

My whole professional life can be summed up by this quote:

"Do right. Do your best. Treat others as you want to be treated." Lou Holtz

My portfolio website is: https://www.eneskirimi.com
See my medium posts at: https://eneskrmi.medium.com/

projects.title: TeamServer redesign & migration
projects.description:
TeamServer is a Java application with an AngularJS front end.  As of 2018, it's dated and needs to be rebuilt with a new and modern design&architecture. With the help of Nemo team, I'm redesigning and migrating the TeamServer front end to HoriZZon, using Angular 6.

The redesign & migration includes dynamically generated pages with dynamic content, forms, search & filtering (internal data - client and server side), tree structures etc.

contributors.headline: Senior Full Stack Engineer at Abcam (contractor)

projects.description: A detailed tool that allows consumers to find correct lamps for their cars. It uses a JSON-based database. Currently deployed at 25 countries with Philips presence.

projects.title: Philips B2C Recategorization
projects.description:
Complete restructuring of B2C landscape of Philips .com website.

Cycle 1 - Mother & Childcare and Automotive business groups - 40000+ webpages have been changed and deployed.

Cycle 2 - Ongoing. By the time I left my position at Philips, cycle 2 was more than halfway complete. It involved 30000+ webpages.

projects.title: Philips Country rollouts
projects.description:
Creating new countries with complete landscapes for Philips. My involvement is for Philips B2C and Corporate .com countries.

My role within this project is implementing, overseeing and configuring various internal Philips systems and Adobe Experience Manager to create new country websites from start to finish for Philips. Everything related to technical or content matters passes through my hands. I either implement it myself or communicate to people within Philips to get it implemented.

Seven new countries spread around the globe have been rolled out for Philips with more countries in the pipeline. Philips Uruguay, Kenya, Ghana, Nigeria, Indonesia, Morocco and Egypt (English) websites are already rolled out.

In 2017, Philips .com presence is expanding to Middle East, with 9 new Middle East country websites. Most of these countries are rolled out.

In total, I've published 157,000+ webpages until the moment I left my job at Philips.

profile_positions.description:
Abcam is a biotechnology company that identifies, develops, and provides high-quality biological reagents and tools which are essential in a wide range of fields and applications including drug discovery, diagnostics and basic research.

In this role, I've been an integral part of building the Abcam's brand new web experience. So far, I have:

- Created dozens of reusable React components, templates and pages as part of customer journeys.
- Architected and implemented an efficient image optimization solution that reduced the image sizes used on the whole Abcam website by up to %95 while maintaining the same quality, thus giving significant SEO and page performance boosts without compromising the user experience.
- Been an SME in regards to AEM Cloud for the whole Abcam organization.
- Revamped, updated and came up with robust ways/services of using content data. Made significant improvements on page speeds in regards to content data.
- Driven and owned company-wide improvements on various occasions.
- Been the go-to person to resolve problems for a significant part of the website.
profile_positions.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Silicon Tiger is the company I use to carry out my contracting/freelancing activities. 

Through Silicon Tiger, I provide web application, website and web platform development services. 

My experience mainly revolves around React and Angular in the front end and Node.js in the back end. I also frequently used relational databases (such as MySQL, MariaDB and PostgreSQL) and have built CI/CD processes with Jenkins, AWS and CircleCI. In these regards, I am a 'T' shaped developer in true fashion.
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description:
In this role, I've strengthened and expanded the digital presence of ERIKS Digital country websites. 

My focus was generally around self-contained React applications within AEM and improving the ERIKS country websites in preparation of June 2021 core web vitals search ranking changes. I've made significant progress on all core web vitals metrics on most of the ERIKS Digital and partner country websites and laid a good foundation for my successors to continue.

While working with ERIKS Digital, I've used AEM, React, Typescript, Javascript, styled components, Jest, internal ERIKS Digital libraries etc..
profile_positions.title: AEM Front End Engineer

profile_positions.description:
In this role, I continued to help Weborama Nederland as a contracted Senior Front End developer on a flexible basis. Compared to my previous role within Weborama Nederland, this is an external and a more consultant-oriented role.

I took high-level features and concepts, processed it and developed it for Previewer II (React 16, Node.js, Express, MariaDB) and Admire II web applications. I also guided and provided mentorship to two junior front end developers, expanded our testing coverage and implemented architectural improvements.
profile_positions.title: Senior Front End Developer

profile_positions.description:
Previewer II (uses React 16, Node.js, Express, MariaDB, Docker) is a web application that allows creative agencies to upload, modify and preview their ads in a safe environment before publishing them to the web. 

I've continued to add new features, fixed further bugs and updated Previewer II to harden it and make it more future-proof. Previewer II has been released in beta status at early 2020.

Additionally, I've worked on a completely new product (React 17, Redux, Material UI) and have finished its mock-ups at the end of December 2020.

I've also spent time on networking tasks at various Weborama NL web servers (NGINX, Docker, Ubuntu). These were mainly DevOps / server management tasks.
profile_positions.title: Senior Front End Developer

profile_positions.description:
Weborama is a company that deals with Rich Media Content for advertisers, creative agencies, publishers and media agencies.

As a Front End Developer at Weborama, my focus is mainly on React applications. In this role, I'm also interacting and developing with NodeJS in a limited capacity.

In this role, I've modernized and done numerous improvements to the Admire II web application (React 16, Docker, NGINX). It has been released in 2019 as v1. Admire II is a web application used by ad traffickers to upload, modify and publish ads. I've added new features, fixed longstanding bugs and introduced unit tests with Jest and Enzyme to the codebase. I'm steadily covering more and more components with unit tests as time passes.

Furthermore, I've updated, polished, fixed bugs and extended Previewer II web application (React 16, Node.js, Express, MariaDB, Docker) in a full stack capacity at this role.
profile_positions.title: Front End Developer

profile_positions.description:
BiZZdesign is a company that focuses on Enterprise Architecture and change management. It's a successful company and its product base consists of several enterprise-grade applications.

While I was at BiZZdesign, I've worked on TeamServer and HoriZZon web applications.

TeamServer used AngularJS at its front end. Most of my time at BiZZdesign was spent on migrating, adding new functionality and improving the UI and UX of the front end to HoriZZon - a modern Angular (Angular 6) single page application.

I've done everything from designing UI at HoriZZon to implementing/processing all kinds of API calls to building forms to generating dynamically created pages with custom dynamic content. I've also built lots of reusable components and integrated & used 3rd party libraries in HoriZZon. I also wrote unit tests with Jasmine and Karma at this role.

Additionally, I've done minor server side development with Java in this role. It concerned search & filtering and consisted of modifying and expanding existing API endpoints, writing new SQL statements etc.
profile_positions.title: Front end Engineer

profile_positions.description:
An Adobe experience manager subject matter expert is a consultant on everything AEM-related within Philips Digital Services.

As an AEM subject matter expert:

- I led projects from a more technical-oriented perspective and solved technical challenges. I additionally have front end development experience, which further helped me in this role.
- I set guidelines and process/roadmap changes within Philips Digital Services.
- I trained people from various organizations on Adobe Experience Manager and Philips library components, page templates we created, Philips systems etc.
- I functioned as a 'problem-solver' on AEM-related issues for digital marketers, managers and service experts.

During my time as a Subject Matter Expert at Philips, I delivered and was a key person at some technically hard projects such as Recategorization of Philips .com consumer websites and Africa and Middle East & Turkey country creation(s). These projects covered creation/modification of hundreds of thousands webpages.
profile_positions.title: Subject Matter Expert - Adobe Experience Manager

profile_positions.description:
In this role, I used to be a member of Projects and Online studio teams.

Some of the things I did at this role are:

- Designing and creating website wireframes to be used on website projects.
- Creating master pages for website projects.
- Localizing webpages within AEM environments.
- Customizing webpages based on client feedback.
- Acting as a consultant on improving webpages.

I routinely used Adobe Experience Manager, Adobe Photoshop CC and Adobe Illustrator CC to achieve/complete the tasks outlined above.

Some examples of my work I did at this role can be found in the projects section. Webpages I built are maintained by different people and their look and feel might change over time.
